newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: KL shares end with extended losses on Dow's fall.
newsitem.headline: KL shares end with extended losses on Dow's fall.

text.p: Kuala Lumpur shares closed with extended losses, in sympathy with weaker regional markets after a 157-point drop on Wall Street overnight, dealers said.

Market sentiment had already been affected by Bank Negara's curbs on lending to property and share buying, announced last Friday. "There was some technical buying but it did not follow through in the afternoon. Sentiment is weak at the moment," said a Mayban Securities dealer.
The Composite Index of 100 large-capitalised stocks ended down 15.33 points at 1,187.77. The index hit its lowest level in three-and-a-half months of 1,182.65 in early trade.
Dealers said shares would remain weak on Wednesday if the Dow fell further.
Analysts said some investors expect the U.S. Federal Reserve to continue tightening interest rates through the year, and that should cap the U.S. stockmarket.
Banking and property stocks remained under selling pressure following the central bank curbs.
Malayan Banking, Arab-Malaysian Merchant Bank, Commerce-Asset, Bandar Raya and Land & General fell between 18 and 80 cents each.
